order.label: order
order.definition: An order facet adds information of the ordering of some information in an aggregation of information. [Allotrope]

report.label: report
report.definition: A document assembled by an author for the purpose of providing information for the audience. A report is the output of a documenting process and has the objective to be consumed by a specific audience. Topic of the report is on something that has completed. A report is not a single figure. Examples of reports are journal article, patent application, grant progress report, case report (not patient record).

complete.label: Complete
complete.definition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

genome.label: genome
genome.definition: A genome is a material entity that represents the entirety of an organism's hereditary information. The genome includes both the genes and the non-coding sequences of the DNA and RNA.

sequence.label: Sequence
sequence.definition: A nucleic acid or protein sequence information.

strain.label: strain
strain.definition: A strain is a quality quantification facet that quantifies the magnitude of deformation representing the displacement between particles in the body relative to a reference length. [Allotrope]

diseased.label: Diseased
diseased.definition: An indication that an anatomic structure has detectable aberrations.

young.label: young
young.definition: An age which is relatively low.

calf.label: Calf
calf.definition: The posterior aspect of the lower extremity that extends from the knee to the foot.

circular.label: circular
circular.definition: A shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being such that every part of the surface or the circumference is equidistant from the center.

chromosome.label: chromosome
chromosome.definition: A structure composed of a very long molecule of DNA and associated proteins (e.g. histones) that carries hereditary information.

content.label: Content
content.definition: Everything that is included in a collection, container, or communication.

bacterium.label: Bacterium
bacterium.definition: The bacterium as a biological material.

zoonotic.label: zoonotic
zoonotic.definition: A disease that can be transmitted from animals to people.

family.label: family
family.definition: A domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.

important.label: Important
important.definition: Of great significance, value, or consequence.

gen.label: GEN
gen.definition: The GEN file format contains genetic data and describes SNPs.

pneumonia.label: pneumonia
pneumonia.definition: A lung disease that involves lung parenchyma or alveolar inflammation and abnormal alveolar filling with fluid (consolidation and exudation). It results from a variety of causes including infection with bacteria, viruses, fungi or parasites, and chemical or physical injury to the lungs. It is accompanied by fever, chills, cough, and difficulty in breathing.

otitis media.label: otitis media
otitis media.definition: A otitis which involves inflammation of the middle ear.

infection.label: infection
infection.definition: A part of an extended organism that itself has as part a population of one or more infectious agents and that (1) exists as a result of processes initiated by members of the infectious agent population and is (2) clinically abnormal in virtue of the presence of this infectious agent population, or (3) has a disposition to bring clinical abnormality to immunocompetent organisms of the same Species as the host (the organism corresponding to the extended organism) through transmission of a member or offspring of a member of the infectious agent population.

mastitis.label: mastitis
mastitis.definition: A breast disease characterized by painful infection of the breast tissue.

cattle.label: cattle
cattle.definition: Cattle (colloquially cows) are the most common type of large domesticated ungulates. They are a prominent modern member of the subfamily *Bovinae*, are the most widespread species of the genus *Bos*, and are most commonly classified collectively as *Bos taurus*... with three subspecies: *Bos taurus primigenius, Bos taurus indicus, Bos taurus taurus*.

secreted.label: secreted
secreted.definition: These proteins are translocated from the inside of the cell to the cell's exterior. Proteins targeted for secretion undergo glycosylation and other postranslational modifications in the endoplasmic reticulum and the golgi complex, and are enclosed in secretory vesicles. The fusion of vesicles to the cell membrane releases the secretory proteins to the exterior. Examples include growth factors, tumor necrosis factors, cytokines, etc.

adhesion.label: adhesion
adhesion.definition: Adherence to a substrate in the environment or in a host.

invasion.label: Invasion
invasion.definition: The movement of one cell type into an area normally occupied by a different cell type.

into.label: Into
into.definition: Expressing entrance, or a passing from the outside of a thing to its interior parts.

host.label: host
host.definition: An organism bearing a host role.

well.label: well
well.definition: A well is a site that is a cavity in a surface open at the top. [Allotrope]

hosts.label: hosts
hosts.definition: Relation between a Platform and a Sensor, Actuator, Sampler, or Platform, hosted or mounted on it.

farm.label: farm
farm.definition: An area of land which is used for the cultivation of crops or grazing of livestock, including any agricultural constructions therein.

serious.label: Serious
serious.definition: Causing fear or anxiety by threatening great harm; of great consequence.

isolate.label: isolate
isolate.definition: Identifier given to a pathogen that has been isolated from an infected host and propagated in a laboratory culture. The isolate information may include an internal reference code from the laboratory that took the sample or performed the isolation, as well as details about the specific conditions of isolation, such as the name of the town, hospital, and type of host.

small.label: Small
small.definition: Limited in number, quantity, magnitude or extent.

affected.label: Affected
affected.definition: To be influenced by or changed.

third.label: Third
third.definition: A suffix denoting the third person having the same complete name (first, middle, and family names).

day.label: day
day.definition: A one-dimensional temporal region which spans the duration an astronomical body completes one rotation on its axis.

when.label: When
when.definition: At what time, how soon, in what circumstances?

slight.label: Slight
slight.definition: Small or little in size, quantity, or degree.

color.label: color
color.definition: A composite chromatic quality composed of hue, saturation and intensity parts.

change.label: Change
change.definition: The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

organism.label: organism
organism.definition: A material entity that is an individual living system, such as animal, plant, bacteria or virus, that is capable of replicating or reproducing, growth and maintenance in the right environment. An organism may be unicellular or made up, like humans, of many billions of cells divided into specialized tissues and organs.

agar.label: agar
agar.definition: A complex mixture of polysaccharides extracted from species of red algae. Its two main components are agarose and agaropectin. Agarose is the component responsible for the high-strength gelling properties of agar, while agaropectin provides the viscous properties.

until.label: Until
until.definition: Up to the point of some specific time or event.

puri\ufb01ed.label: purified
puri\ufb01ed.definition: Molecule has undergone one or more purification steps to isolate it from the cellular environment.

isolation.label: Isolation
isolation.definition: A state of separation; the act of isolating something; setting something apart from others; marked by separation of or from usually contiguous elements.

pcr.label: polymerase chain reaction
pcr.definition: PCR is the process in which a DNA polymerase is used to amplify a piece of DNA by in vitro enzymatic replication. As PCR progresses, the DNA thus generated is itself used as a template for replication. This sets in motion a chain reaction in which the DNA template is exponentially amplified.

targeting.label: Targeting
targeting.definition: The process of directing an agent to a specific anatomic location.

gene.label: gene
gene.definition: A gene is a material entity that represents the entire DNA sequence required for synthesis of a functional protein or RNA molecule.

after.label: after
after.definition: T1 after t2 iff:= t2 before_or_simulataneous_with t1 and not (t1 simultaeous_with t2)

fresh.label: fresh
fresh.definition: A raw characteristic of organism(s) or organism pieces(s) which show little or no sign of decay, and which have not been subjected to rehydration or thawing.

culture.label: Culture
culture.definition: A pattern of learned beliefs, values, and behavior that are shared within a group. It includes language, styles of communication, practices, customs, and views on roles and relationships.

cell.label: cell
cell.definition: A material entity of anatomical origin (part of or deriving from an organism) that has as its parts a maximally connected cell compartment surrounded by a plasma membrane.

genomic dna.label: Genomic DNA
genomic dna.definition: The DNA that is part of the normal chromosomal complement of an organism.

dna.label: DNA
dna.definition: High molecular weight, linear polymers, composed of nucleotides containing deoxyribose and linked by phosphodiester bonds; DNA contain the genetic information of organisms (from CHEBI).

quanti\ufb01ed by.label: quantified by
quanti\ufb01ed by.definition: Relation of something that is quantified by some quantity value which expresses it relative to some other thing. [Allotrope]

\ufb02uorometer.label: fluorometer
\ufb02uorometer.definition: A fluorometer is an instrument for the detection and measurement of parameters of fluoresence, which in turn are used to identify the presence and amount of specific molecules in the sample.

high.label: High
high.definition: An elevated level or position or degree; greater than normal in degree or intensity or amount.

density.label: Density
density.definition: The amount of something per unit size.

construct.label: Construct
construct.definition: An abstract or general idea inferred or derived from specific instances.

fragment.label: Fragment
fragment.definition: A part of a larger entity.

software.label: software
software.definition:
Software is a plan specification composed of a series of instructions that can be 
interpreted by or directly executed by a processing unit.

default parameters.label: default parameters
default parameters.definition: It is possible that this really should be a class instead of an individual, namely the class of all default parameter specifications (which would then have instances specific to programs).

truseq.label: TruSeq
truseq.definition: TruSeq is a library preparation protocol developed by Illumina for RNA sequencing. It includes different types of kits for different purposes, such as the TruSeq Small RNA Library Prep Kit and the TruSeq RNA Exome. These kits are designed to convert total RNA or genomic DNA into template molecules of known strand origin for sequencing.

sequencing.label: sequencing
sequencing.definition: Refers to the level of sequencing performed on the nucleic acid. Possible values include 'Not sequenced' (no sequencing has been performed), 'Partly sequenced' (only a portion of the nucleic acid sequence has been determined), and 'Fully sequenced' (the entire nucleic acid sequence has been determined).

data analysis.label: data analysis
data analysis.definition: A process of inspecting, cleaning, transforming, and modeling data with the goal of highlighting useful information, suggesting conclusions, and supporting decision making.

read.label: read
read.definition: A read is a process boundary within a measuring where a data about the measured object is captured. [Allotrope]

number.label: number
number.definition: Number types can have min / max limits for validation.  Regular expressions would be used mostly for data entry transformation and display.

read length.label: read length
read length.definition: A datum of the number of base pairs per read.

performed.label: Performed
performed.definition: Executed and carried through to completion.

illumina hiseq.label: Illumina HiSeq
illumina hiseq.definition: A DNA sequencer manufactured by the Illumina corporation using sequence-by-synthesis chemistry, enabling deep sequencing and high yield.

platform.label: Platform
platform.definition: A Platform is an entity that hosts other entities, particularly Sensors, Actuators, Samplers, and other Platforms.

mode.label: Mode
mode.definition: The value which occurs most often in a set of values. If no value is repeated, there is no mode. If more than one value occurs with the same greatest frequency, each value is a mode.

paired-end sequencing.label: Paired-End Sequencing
paired-end sequencing.definition: A DNA sequencing strategy where a single read is initiated from each end of a DNA fragment.

insert size.label: Insert Size
insert size.definition: The number of nucleotides inserted into a sequencing vector.

standard.label: standard
standard.definition: A standard is a norm or requirement that is established for technical systems. [Wikipedia]

library preparation.label: library preparation
library preparation.definition: is a process which results in the creation of a library from fragments of DNA using cloning vectors or oligonucleotides with the role of adaptors.

library.label: library
library.definition: A curated collection of sources of information and similar resources, selected by experts and made accessible to a defined community for reference or borrowing. It provides physical or digital access to material, and may be a physical location or a virtual space, or both.

preparation.label: Preparation
preparation.definition: The act or process of making something ready.

access.label: Access
access.definition: The right to obtain or make use of or take advantage of something (as services or membership); the right to enter.  Also, an act or means of approaching.

article.label: Article
article.definition: Nonfictional prose forming an independent part of a publication.

distributed.label: distributed
distributed.definition: A spatial pattern inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being spread out or scattered about or divided up.

n50.label: N50
n50.definition: the weighted median item size or N50 is a weighted median of the lengths of items, equal to the length of the longest item i such that the sum of the lengths of items greater than or equal in length to i is greater than or equal to half the length of all of the items. With regard to assemblies the items are typically contigs or scaffolds. It therefore denotes the ability of the software to create contigs and provides information about the resulting sequence assembly

value.label: Value
value.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

aliquot.label: Aliquot
aliquot.definition: Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.

then.label: Then
then.definition: Occurring at a time in the near future.

end.label: end
end.definition: The process boundary when the process ends. [Allotrope]

three.label: Three
three.definition: A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.

combination.label: Combination
combination.definition: A collection of things that have been assembled together to form a new whole.

pacbio rs.label: PacBio RS
pacbio rs.definition: A DNA sequencer manufactured by the Pacific Biosciences corporation which utilizes “SMRT Cells” for single-molecule real-time sequencing. The RS was the first model made by the company.

data.label: Data
data.definition: Subclass of File representing structured or unstructured datasets, often used for analysis, storage, or transfer of information.

complexity.label: complexity
complexity.definition: A monadic quality of continuant inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being intricate and compounded.

correct.label: Correct
correct.definition: Free from error; especially conforming to fact or truth.

long.label: Long
long.definition: A variable that is stored as a signed 64-bit (8-byte) integer.

genome assembly.label: genome assembly
genome assembly.definition: The result of reconstruction of the genome achieved by aligning and merging smaller fragments.

assembly.label: assembly
assembly.definition: The process of individual components of a sample associating to form a new pattern or structure.

multiple.label: multiple
multiple.definition: A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being present in more than two copies.

longest.label: Longest
longest.definition: Having the greater length of two or the greatest length of several.

result.label: result
result.definition: Analysis of raw data generated by an assay(s) that makes some conclusion.

size.label: size
size.definition: A morphology quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's physical magnitude.

information.label: Information
information.definition: Knowledge derived from study, experience, or instruction that has been gathered or received by communication.

custom.label: custom
custom.definition: Frequent repetition of the same behavior; way of behavior common to many; ordinary manner; habitual practice; method of doing, living or behaving.

to assemble.label: to assemble
to assemble.definition: to assemble is the capability to combine entities together into a larger object that persists in time.

corrected.label: Corrected
corrected.definition: Having had errors or mistakes removed.

generation.label: Generation
generation.definition: An instance of prov:Generation provides additional descriptions about the binary prov:wasGeneratedBy relation from a generated prov:Entity to the prov:Activity that generated it. For example, :cake prov:wasGeneratedBy :baking; prov:qualifiedGeneration [ a prov:Generation; prov:activity :baking; :foo :bar ].

sequencing data.label: Sequencing Data
sequencing data.definition: A collection of digital nucleic acid sequences, protein sequences, or other polymer sequences stored on a computer.

remaining.label: Remaining
remaining.definition: Enduring or persisting; residual, left over or behind.

local.label: Local
local.definition: Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality.

inner.label: Inner
inner.definition: Inside or closer to the inside of the body or object.

\ufb01nal.label: Final
\ufb01nal.definition: Conclusive in a process or progression.

total.label: Total
total.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.

present.label: present
present.definition: A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's existence.

two.label: Two
two.definition: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.

length.label: length
length.definition: Length is a quality quantification facet that quantifies the distance between two points in space. [Allotrope]

accession.label: Accession
accession.definition: The process of increasing by addition (as to a collection or group).

associated.label: Associated
associated.definition: Joined in some kind of relationship.

genbank accession.label: GenBank accession
genbank accession.definition: Accession number of an entry from the GenBank sequence database.

genbank.label: GenBank
genbank.definition: The NIH genetic sequence database, an annotated collection of all publicly available DNA sequences. GenBank records are annotated using a standard set of biological terms and show these annotations in a Feature Table.

biosample.label: biosample
biosample.definition: Biological source material characterized by an experiment.

work.label: work
work.definition: A physical quality which is equal to the energy transferred by a force to a moving object.

both.label: Both
both.definition: One and the other; relating to or being two in conjunction.

involved in.label: involved in
involved in.definition: C involved_in p if and only if c enables some process p', and p' is part of p [RO]

made.label: made
made.definition: Something that was made by this agent.

equal.label: equal
equal.definition: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is equal to the object.

listed.label: Listed
listed.definition: Included on a list of items.

agent of.label: agent of
agent of.definition: 'agent of' is a relation between a participant and a process, in which the participant is active in the relevant process.

agent.label: agent
agent.definition: An agent is an identifier that identifies the agent performing some action. [Allotrope]

genital.label: Genital
genital.definition: The group of organs and glands involved with having a child. In women, these are the uterus (womb), the fallopian tubes, the ovaries, and the vagina (birth canal). The reproductive system in men includes the testes, the prostate, and the penis.

dairy.label: dairy
dairy.definition: A dairy is a building in which animal milk is harvested and, optionally, processed for human consumption.

comparative genomics.label: Comparative genomics
comparative genomics.definition: The study (typically comparison) of the sequence, structure or function of multiple genomes.

plasma.label: plasma
plasma.definition: Plasma is a state of matter in which an ionized gaseous substance becomes highly electrically conductive to the point that long-range electric and magnetic fields dominate the behavior of the matter. [Wikipedia]

decreased virulence.label: decreased virulence
decreased virulence.definition: An altered virulence phenotype where the rate, frequency, timing, or extent of the ability of a microbe to cause disease in another organism (the host) is decreased relative to a designated control.

potential.label: Potential
potential.definition: The likelihood or possibility that a specific state or condition will exist or that an action will occur.

based on.label: based on
based on.definition: The sequence on which the description of a modified sequence is based.

locus.label: Locus
locus.definition: The position of a gene or a chromosomal marker on a chromosome; also, a stretch of DNA at a particular place on a particular chromosome. The use of locus is sometimes restricted to mean regions of DNA that are expressed.

tandem repeat.label: Tandem repeat
tandem repeat.definition: Two or more adjacent copies of a region (of length greater than 1).

identi\ufb01cation.label: Identification
identi\ufb01cation.definition: A taxonomic determination (e.g., the assignment to a taxon).

assembler.label: Assembler
assembler.definition: Occupations held by individuals who assemble prefabricated parts of components to form subassemblies, products and equipment.

short.label: Short
short.definition: A variable that is stored as a signed 16-bit (2-byte) integer.

large.label: Large
large.definition: Of considerable or relatively great size, extent, or capacity.

nome.label: Nome
nome.definition: A person having origins in the original Nome people.

repeat.label: Repeat
repeat.definition: Make or do or perform again.

analysis.label: analysis
analysis.definition: A result that is produced from the detailed examination of data to come to some conclusion.

pathogen.label: Pathogen
pathogen.definition: Biological entity that causes disease in its host, which is typically an infectious microorganism or agent, such as a virus, bacterium, protozoan, prion, viroid, or fungus.

methicillin-resistant staphylococcus aur.label: methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus
methicillin-resistant staphylococcus aur.definition: Any strain of Staphylococcus aureus that has tested resistant (R) to at least one of methicillin, oxacillin or cefoxitin by standard susceptibility testing methods.

usa.label: USA
usa.definition: USA is a country that exists in north America.

black.label: black
black.definition: A color that lacks any hues as parts.

soldier.label: soldier
soldier.definition: A person who fights as part of an army. A soldier can be a conscripted or volunteer enlisted person, a non-commissioned officer, or an officer.

biological.label: Biological
biological.definition: Pertaining to biology or to life and living things.

conversion.label: Conversion
conversion.definition: PEFF keyword for the description of the conversion from original format to this current one.

animal.label: animal
animal.definition: Any of a kingdom (Animalia) of living things including many-celled organisms and often many of the single-celled ones (as protozoans) that typically differ from plants in having cells without cellulose walls, in lacking chlorophyll and the capacity for photosynthesis, in requiring more complex food materials (as proteins), in being organized to a greater degree of complexity, and in having the capacity for spontaneous movement and rapid motor responses to stimulation.

plant.label: plant
plant.definition: Any of a kingdom (Plantae) of living things typically lacking locomotive movement or obvious nervous or sensory organs and possessing cellulose cell walls.

ingredients.label: ingredients
ingredients.definition: A single ingredient used in the recipe, e.g. sugar, flour or garlic.

may.label: May
may.definition: The fifth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar.

problem.label: Problem
problem.definition: A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

adoption.label: adoption
adoption.definition: A process whereby a person assumes the parenting of another, usually a child, from that person's biological or legal parent or parents.

some.label: Some
some.definition: At least a small amount or number of, but not a large amount of, or often.

antimicrobial.label: antimicrobial
antimicrobial.definition: A material entity with an antimicrobial disposition.

associated with.label: associated with
associated with.definition: A structural quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being in close proximity and physically interacting with another entity.

mrsa.label: mrsA
mrsa.definition: Probable phospho-sugar mutase / MrsA protein homolog

potato.label: potato
potato.definition: A shoot axis tuber of a potato plant (Solanum tuberosum).

containing.label: containing
containing.definition: Containing is the state of keeping an object in the inside of a cavity. [Allotrope]

glass.label: glass
glass.definition: Glass is an amorphous (non-crystalline) solid which is often transparent.

taken.label: Taken
taken.definition: Having been accepted for some purpose; ingested as a medication.

diversity.label: Diversity
diversity.definition: Variety; quality, state, fact, or instance of being different.

internal.label: Internal
internal.definition: Happening or arising or located within some limits, or especially, within some surface.

reduced.label: reduced
reduced.definition: Qualifier that describes a phenotype that has reduced penetrance or expressivity when compared to wild-type.

reduction.label: reduction
reduction.definition: Mutation caused by a recombination event between tandem repeats of rRNA genes that causes unequal chromatid exchange at crossing over and a reduction in the number of functional copies. It leads to an aggravation of phenotype, in the case of a mutation causing a change from a wildtype to mutant phenotype or a change from a mutant to a more severe mutant phenotype.
